meanings.definition: To remove furniture or furnishings from a space.
meanings.sent1: I will disfurnish the living room before painting the walls.
meanings.sent2: It is necessary to disfurnish the office for the renovation.
meanings.sent3: When I disfurnished the bedroom, I found a lost sock under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The empty room echoed after I disfurnished it completely.
meanings.sent5: She decided to disfurnish the entire house to start fresh.

meanings.definition: To deprive of furniture or furnishings.
meanings.sent1: The landlord had to disfurnish the apartment after the tenant left abruptly.
meanings.sent2: The storm disfurnished the beach house, leaving it bare and exposed.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally disfurnished the dining room when I moved the table too quickly.
meanings.sent4: The thief disfurnished the mansion, leaving behind only empty rooms.
meanings.sent5: The decision to disfurnish the office was met with mixed reactions from the employees.
